What steps does PRMSU take to ensure the safety of students?
Please tell me about the security measures and safety initiatives in PRMSU for students.
Are there any specific programs or services that PRMSU offers to ensure the safety of students?
responses:
Ensuring student safety on campus is a top priority for universities. There are several ways universities can ensure student safety on campus. Some of these include:
Providing adequate lighting in all areas of the campus.
Installing security cameras in strategic locations
Providing emergency phones throughout the campus
Providing self-defense classes for students.
Providing safety escorts for students who need to travel alone at night.
Conduct regular safety drills and training sessions for students and staff.
Providing mental health services for students who may be struggling with personal issues.
Encouraging students to report any suspicious activity or behavior.

patterns: What is the admissions process, and what are the requirements for admission?
How do I apply for admission in PRMSU
What are the steps for admission in prmsu
responses:
Admission Process:
Obtain an application form from the university's admissions office or website.
Fill out the application form and submit it with the necessary documents and application fee.
Wait for the university to process your application and inform you of the status of your application.
If accepted, follow the enrollment process, pay the necessary fees, and attend the orientation.
Admission Requirements:
A high school diploma for undergraduate programs or a bachelor's degree for graduate programs.
Transcript of records or official report cards showing your academic performance.
A certificate of good moral character from your previous school.
Birth certificate (original and photocopy).
Two recent 2x2 ID photos.
For transfer students, a certificate of honorable dismissal from the previous school.
Additional requirements may be required depending on the program you are applying for.
It's best to contact the admissions office of President Ramon Magsaysay State University Iba Campus to get more specific information regarding the admission requirements and process for the program you are interested in.

patterns: what is the meaning of prmsu?
responses: Founded in 1910, President Ramon Magsaysay State University is a for-profit private higher education institution that offers courses and programs leading to officially recognized higher education degrees such as pre- bachelor's degrees. The acceptance rate range is 100% and international students are welcome to apply for enrollment. PRMSU also provides several academic and non-academic facilities and services to students, including a library, sports facilities, financial aid and/or scholarships, online courses and distance learning opportunities, and administrative services.

patterns: what is the date of second year enrollment?
responses: The date of enrollment for the second year is on July 31 to August 4, 2023.

patterns: what is the date of 3rd year enrollment?
responses: The enrollment schedule for the third year is on August 7 to 11, 2023.

patterns: what is the date of 4th year enrollment?
what is the date of 5th year enrollment?
responses: The enrollment schedule for the fourth and fifth year is on August 14 to 18, 2023.

patterns: When is the enrollment schedule for late enrollees?
responses: The enrollment schedule for late enrollees is August 21 to 25, 2023.

'The PRMSU shall primarily provide advance and higher professional, technical, and special instructions in various disciplines; undertake research, extension and income generation programs for the sustainable development of Zambales, the region and the country.'
This is the mission of President Ramon Magsaysay State University

patterns: What is the vision of Prmsu
responses: The vision of President Ramon Magsaysay State University is 'PRMSU shall be a premier learner-centered and proactive university in a digital and global society.'

patterns: What is the university quality policy

responses: President Ramon Magsaysay State University's quality policy is 'The President Ramon Magsaysay State University is committed to continually strive for excellence in instruction, research, extension and production to strenghten global competitiveness adhering to quality standards for the utmost satisfaction of its valued customers.'

patterns: What is the grading system of Prmsu?
How does the university grade their students?
What is the grading system used by PRMSU?
I'm interested in knowing how PRMSU's grading system works.
what is the grading style of prmsu?
responses: The President Ramon Magsaysay State University follows a 5-Point Scale as its grading system, wherein the highest passing grade is 1.0 (99-100%), lowest passing grade is 3.0 (75-77%), and lowest grade is 5.0 which is the failing mark. 'INC' or Incomplete remark is also given if the student fails to take the final examination for valid reasons or if other course requirements are not satisfied.

responses: Yes. Students shall be accepted regardless of age, sex, status, nationality, disabilities, ethnicity and religious beliefs or political affiliations. Students with special needs are provided with special facilities such as ramps and priority lanes. This is given that they comply with the admission requirements of the university.

patterns: I'm a working student. Can I still apply for admission at PRMSU?
Can working students apply for admission at PRMSU?
I work part-time. Can I still pursue admission at PRMSU?
responses: Yes. Working students shall also be admitted upon submission of the admission requirements.

Working students are eligible to apply for admission at PRMSU. PRMSU may offer flexible scheduling options or part-time programs to accommodate the needs of working students. It is advised to consult the official admissions guidelines provided by PRMSU for specific information on application procedures and any provisions for working students.

PRMSU recognizes the circumstances of part-time working students and encourages their application. They may have flexible programs or support services to assist part-time working students. For specific information on the application process and available options, it is best to consult the official admissions guidelines provided by PRMSU.

what are the admission requirements for junior high

I'm planning to apply to Junior High School. What are the requirements?
responses: Certainly, Here is the list of the requirements for Junior High School: 1.Form 138 or Form 137 2.Certificate of Good Moral Character from last school attended 3.Two (2) pieces 2”x2” latest identical pictures 4.PSA authenticated copy of birth certificate 5.PSA authenticated copy of Marriage Certificate (For married female applicant) 6.PRMSU Secondary Admission Test (PRMSU SAT)

responses: Certainly, Here is the list of requirements for application of Beginning Freshmen or New student: 1.Form 138 of Form 137 2.Certificate of Good Moral Character from last school attended 3.Two (2) pieces 2x2 inchess latest identical pictures 4.PSA authenticated copy of birth certificate 5.PSA authenticated copy of Marriage Certificate For married female applicant 6.Medical Certificate from authorized Health Officer.

patterns: I'm a transferee. What are the requirements for admission?

responses: Certainly, If you are a transferee planning to apply for admission at PRMSU, here is the list of requirements you need: 1.Transfer Credential / Honorable Dismissal 2.Official Transcript of Record / Copy of Grades duly signed by the Campus Registrar 3.Certificate of Good Moral Character from the last school attended 4.PRSMU College Admission Test (PRMSU  CAT) (If applicable) 5.Admission of transferees is subject to the availability of a slot in the college one wants to enroll 6.Original PSA Birth Certificate 7.Original PSA Marriage Certificate for married female applicant

patterns: What is the total number of units students may register?
total number of units to register
what is the limit of units student can take
responses: The total number of units for which a student may register shall be in accordance with the curricular program the student is enrolled in.

patterns: Am I allowed to skip prerquisite subjects
responses: Enrolling in and attendance in a subject without passing its prerequisites shall earn the student no academic credit.

patterns: Am I allowed to simultaneously enroll in prerequisites and advanced classes?
Can I enroll in prerequisites and advanced classes at the same time?
Is it possible to take both prerequisites and advanced classes concurrently at PRMSU?
responses:
Yes, but in certain conditions;
When the pre-requisite is a repeated subject, When the student has a superior scholastic standing, When the student is graduating at the end of the school term, When it is approved by the Dean of the College of the Program chairperson in the case of satellite campuses.

patterns: Can I still change/add subjects after enrollment?
Can I still change or add subjects after enrollment?
Is it possible to modify or add subjects after the enrollment process?
Am I allowed to make changes to my enrolled subjects or add new subjects?
responses: Yes. A student may be allowed to change and add subjects within two weeks from the first day of classes during the semester, or within the first three days of classes during the mid-year class.

patterns: Am I allowed to drop subjects?
responses: Yes. Dropping of subjects shall be allowed before the midterm. However, an unofficial dropping of the subject will mean a grade of 5.0.

patterns: I'm done taking my entrance exam, where can I find the result?
Where can I find the result of my entrance exam after completing it?
responses: If you're done taking the entrance exam, you may visit the Student Services and Quality Assurance Building 3rd floor for the result. Kindly bring the official receipt and a copy of your Form 138 1st and 2nd quarter grades.

patterns: How to apply for online application admission at PRMSU?
responses:
For online application for admission, the first step is to:
1.Visit the PRMSU Official Website (Website URL: www.prmsu.edu.ph).
2.Select ONLINE ENROLLMENT in the Main Menu.
3.Select the “Campus you intend to apply for admission”.
4.Tap/Click the ADMISSION BUTTON.
5.Click the NEW APPLICANT CHECKBOX (The system will generate a CONTOL NUMBER which will be used in viewing the status of your online application.
6.Fill out all the details/data required for the online application.
7.Upload the required and appropriate documents. Click UPDATE. (Documents should be in JPEG.
8.Check the “STATUS of your online application by visiting the OAES and key in your CONTROL NUMBER. Press ENTER. (If status is APPROVED, then submit your ORIGINAL ADMISSION REQUIREMENTS. If the status is DISAPPROVED, then REAPPLY. If the status is NO ACTION TAKEN, then the application is still being evaluated. If the status is PENDING, call the concerned college’s attention.

patterns: Can I wear civilian clothes when attending classes?
What is the dress code for attending classes?
responses: All students must wear the prescribed uniform. Men students must wear White Polo, black pants, and black formal shoes. Females must wear blue skirt with one inch below the knee cut/ or slacks, white blouses with necktie, and black formal shoes. However, Friday is the prescribed “WASH DAY”. Students must wear the enrollmentnization/college shirt.

patterns: Can I keep my hair long?
Is there a specific rule on hair length for students?
responses: All students must wear the prescribed uniform. Men students must wear White Polo, black pants, and black formal shoes. Females must wear blue skirt with one inch below the knee cut/ or slacks, white blouses with necktie, and black formal shoes. However, Friday is the prescribed “WASH DAY”. Students must wear the enrollmentnization/college shirt.

patterns: Can I enter the school without my ID?
Are students required to have their IDs with them to access the school?
responses:
The university strictly implements the NO ID, NO ENTRY Policy. However, provisions may apply for the following conditions:
1. In case a student failed to present their ID, the Certificate of Registration must be presented to the security personnel. The guard on duty shall affix their signature at the back of the COR for monitoring purposes.
2. Loss of ID shall be reported to the Office of the Registrar together with the notarized affidavit of loss. The registrar will then issue a temporary pass while waiting for the new ID.

patterns: How can I view my grades and academic records?
Is there online platforms to see my grades
responses: Any of your academic records are accessible through PRMSU SIAS 3 at https://icloudph.com/prmsu-main/sias/. Login by entering your user-id and password by clicking the 'Student' button, login using your username and password, and then select the 'Reports' tab from the navigation bar.
